body_html:
As suggested by @fmassa on Slack, I'm pointing out a branch:
https://github.com/lantiga/pytorch/tree/blocks
that adds namespace annotations to nodes with just very minor additions to the code.

Example here: https://gist.github.com/lantiga/15ba60f6dbdbc99873f0af94761e9630. There's something weird going on in the graph generated from Test2, but it's likely the way I traverse the IR graph. Also, the way I get input names is superseded by this PR.

Mentioning this here since it would be nice to include annotations to the ONNX export, for debugging/visualization purposes.

As suggested by @fmassa on Slack, I'm pointing out a branch:
https://github.com/lantiga/pytorch/tree/blocks
that adds namespace annotations to nodes with just very minor additions to the code.
Example here: https://gist.github.com/lantiga/15ba60f6dbdbc99873f0af94761e9630. There's something weird going on in the graph generated from Test2, but it's likely the way I traverse the IR graph. Also, the way I get input names is superseded by this PR.
Mentioning this here since it would be nice to include annotations to the ONNX export, for debugging/visualization purposes.
body:
As suggested by @fmassa on Slack, I'm pointing out a branch:
https://github.com/lantiga/pytorch/tree/blocks
that adds namespace annotations to nodes with just very minor additions to the code.

Example here: https://gist.github.com/lantiga/15ba60f6dbdbc99873f0af94761e9630. There's something weird going on in the graph generated from Test2, but it's likely the way I traverse the IR graph. Also, the way I get input names is superseded by this PR.

Mentioning this here since it would be nice to include annotations to the ONNX export, for debugging/visualization purposes.
